STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 9, 2025
Maureen Clore
ANTRIM/CHARLEVOIX/EMMET COUNTY DHHS
2229 SUMMIT PARK DR,
PETOSKEY, MI, 49770-8636
Re: License #: CP240201034
Dear Ms. Clore:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
8/27/2025. Due to the violation of an applicable licensing rule, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City MI 49684
231-383-5531
enclosure
2

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or
parents and the foster parents in the development
of service plans to enable the parent or parents
and foster parents to understand the plan for the
child and the parents' and the foster parent's role
in assisting the agency in carrying out the plan. An
agency shall give a copy to and review the parent-
agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the
information in the parent-agency treatment plan
and any other information about the child and the
child's family is confidential.
Two of three files reviewed each documented late signatures on PATP"s. One file
documented a late signature on a PATP and the second file documented two
PATP's with late signatures.
2

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• The agency was informed DCWL is no longer auditing any DHHS Policy.
DCWL Consultants will only be auditing rules described in the "Licensing
Rules For Child Placing Agencies" rule book.
• The agency was also informed that a social work contact documenting the
foster care worker reviewed the PATP with the foster parent and other
relevant parties and provided them with a copy of the treatment plan would
meet the rule when obtaining signatures was not possible
V. CONSULTATION
• Consultation was not requested or required at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There was 1 substantiated incident of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. The agency initiated special evaluation #2025SEC0000550 on 4/23/2025
as it was alleged that the foster parent left children under the age of 6 in a locked
car while she took another child into an appointment. The children were left in the
car unsupervised for 15-20 minutes. The agency found the foster parent in
violation of rules Rule 400.9413-1 and R 400.9401-1-a. The agency generated a
corrective action plan the foster parent is to follow. None of the children were
injured.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The CAP
was submitted on 8/14/2024 in response to a rule violation established during the
7/25/2024 Renewal Inspection. The agency was found to be in violation of Rule
400.12417 a-j. The current Interim inspection did not establish a repeat violation of
the rule indicating the agency CAP was successful in preventing a repeat violation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators Annual Assessment was reviewed and was found to be
thorough and well written. The assessment addressed the rule violation from the
renewal audit and agency efforts to prevent a repeat violation. The assessment
was detailed regarding its own internal audits and subsequent efforts to address
areas of deficiency's. Barriers were addressed and spoke to case workers efforts
and difficulty in meeting foster care requirements and the respective timelines.
3

The assessment also spoke to agency strengths such as caseworker contacts
with children and families.
Financial Overview
The agency is a local DHHS office and financial records were not available.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported enjoying working for the agency. Staff stated they feel supported by
their respective supervisors and the agency administration. Staff further reported
they feel they are part of a supportive and quality team.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern facility in Petoskey MI. There is sufficient office
space for staff and a conference room for meetings. The agency has a staffed
lobby to serve the public. CHRI documents were observed to be secured as
required by the rule.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst identified six safety alerts during her visits to the homes. They are
as follows.
Safety Alert # 1. A safety alert was generated on 7/24/2025 as the home has a pond
and there was not an appropriate safety plan.
Resolution: Resolution was achieved on 7/29/2025 as a safety plan was completed
and a photo of the plan was submitted and was found to be adequate.
Safety Alert # 2. A safety alert was generated on 7/28/2025 as a smoke alarm was
missing between a bedroom and the rest of the home.
Resolution: Resolution was achieved on 7/31/2025 and photos of the installed alarm
were provided.
Safety Alert # 3. A safety alert was generated on 7/30/2025 as there was not a smoke
alarm for the upstairs bedroom area and no smoke alarm near the foster child's
bedroom and the rest of the home.
Resolution: Resolution was achieved on 8/06/2025 as photos of the installed alarms
were provided.
Safety Alert # 4. A safety alert was generated on 7/29/2025 as there was no smoke
alarm near the master bedroom and the foster child's bedroom.
Resolution: Resolution was achieved on 8/07/2025 as a smoke alarm was installed
between the master bedroom and the rest of the home. A photo of the installed alarm
was provided.
Safety Alert # 5. A safety alert was generated on 8/05/2025 as there was no smoke
alarm between the master bedroom and the rest of the house.
4

Resolution: Resolution was achieved on 8/07/2025 as a smoke alarm was installed
and a photo provided.
Safety Alert # 6. A safety alert was generated on 7/28/2025 as there was no water
rescue equipment near a hot tube and firearm ammunition was not stored securely.
Resolution: Resolution was achieved 8/13/2025. Photos of the locked ammunition
were provided as well as a photo of a safety ring next to the hot tube.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
September 8, 2025
________________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 9, 2025

Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
